author: Michael Larabel
description: With the great upstream support for AMD Radeon graphics in the Linux kernel and Mesa, most desktop users / gamers / enthusiasts are best off just using the latest code shipped by their distributions or via the enthusiast-supported third-party archives/repositories. But for those on older enterprise Linux distributions, Radeon Software for Linux 25.20.3 was recently released for shipping that packaged AMD Linux graphics driver stack. This 25.20 series is the big one where they are now officially supporting the Mesa RADV Vulkan driver in place of their own former Vulkan Linux driver...
title: Radeon Software for Linux 25.20.3 Released - "Exclusively Open-Source" With RADV

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the release of ROCm 7.1 from just under one month ago, ROCm 7.1.1 is now available with expanded Linux operating system support, continued Instinct MI350 series work, more large language models working on RDNA4 GPUs, and other enhancements...
title: AMD ROCm 7.1.1 Released With RHEL 10.1 Support, More Models Working On RDNA4

author: Michael Larabel
description: It's been just over one year now since the launch of the Core Ultra 9 285K and other Arrow Lake desktop processors. For those that may be considering an Arrow Lake CPU this holiday season for a Linux desktop or just curious how the power and performance has evolved one year later, here are some leading-edge benchmarks of the Intel Core Ultra 9 285K compared to the launch-day performance last October.
title: Intel Core Ultra 9 285K "Arrow Lake" Linux Performance Up ~9% One Year Later At ~85% Power Use

author: Michael Larabel
description: KDE developers announced they are going "all-in on a Wayland future" and with the Plasma 6.8 desktop it will become Wayland-exclusive. The Plasma X11 session is going away...
title: KDE Plasma 6.8 Will Go Wayland-Exclusive In Dropping X11 Session Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: A Fedora special interest group is being proposed to help improve production stability of Fedora Linux and better handling incident management when problems do arise...
title: Fedora SIG Proposed To Improve Production Stability

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Linux 6.18 kernel is anticipated for release this coming Sunday while this week a last-minute crisis was averted following reports of a kernel crash from recent ACPI code changes...
title: Urgent ACPI Revert For Linux 6.18 To Deal With Some Hardware Crashing

author: Michael Larabel
description: NVIDIA engineers are interested in helping Google bring Vulkan Video accelerated GPU video decoding to the Chrome/Chromium web browser...
title: NVIDIA Is Interested In Helping Bring Vulkan Video To Chrome

author: Michael Larabel
description: Sean Christopherson of Google sent out the pull requests to the KVM tree of the various x86_64-related areas of virtualization he oversees. With these updates ahead of the Linux 6.19 merge window there is a significant overhaul of Intel's Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) code to address various outstanding problems...
title: Linux 6.19 Overhauling The Intel TDX Locking Code For KVM

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the release of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10.1 earlier this month, Rocky Linux 10.1 is now available for this popular community-driven alternative to RHEL 10.1...
title: Rocky Linux 10.1 Released As Community Alternative To RHEL 10.1
